main event: Various UFO sightings and reports were made at Keesler AFB, Mississippi, during the 1950s, including the observation of a round, white object shooting downward and a formation of four bright, metallic objects traveling at high speeds.
interesting points: One sighting described a round, white object comparable to a balloon, but the object was observed shooting downward with a trail similar to dying pyrotechnics.

An instructor pilot reported observing four objects in a 'V' formation traveling at speeds estimated to be 1,000 to 1,500 mph. The objects were bright and appeared to be metallic with no observed trails or exhaust.

A witness, Airman First Class Gerald T. McCabe, reported a sighting of a bright light at an estimated altitude of 3,000 feet. The witness was noted to be experienced, with 500 hours logged as a navigator during World War II.

One report mentioned the sighting of an extremely bright light in the sky that appeared to curve downward and increase in size before disappearing. The witness, Second Lieutenant Gerald F. McCain, emphasized that the object made no sound and had no visible wings or tail surfaces.
The evaluating officer in one report noted the short duration of the sightings and the lack of accurate data, making it difficult to determine the reliability of the reports.
sighted object: various unidentified objects including bright lights, metallic objects, and round, white objects
witnesses: multiple Air Force personnel including pilots, instructor pilots, and Airman First Class Gerald T. McCabe
